cont.entity_a: The poacher dimensions are smaller than listed, affecting its use for larger fish.
Fits well on an oval-shaped gas burner and can be used in the oven.
cont.entity_b: Fits nicely on two burners and works efficiently.

cont.entity_a: Nicely designed and easy to lift contents.
cont.entity_b: The design is slightly off, with the steamer tray sitting on the bottom.

cont.entity_a: A handle fell off upon first use, indicating poor construction. Handles are not riveted, leading to potential safety hazards.
cont.entity_b: Handles are tack welded with tiny welds, prone to breaking. Received with broken handles, indicating poor manufacturing. Received with broken handles, poor quality control.

cont.entity_a: Fish steams well when used correctly, but fish can stick to the tray. The poacher is perfect for steaming ribs, creating a flavorful broth.
cont.entity_b: Great for baking cakes, lasagna, and steaming fish. Adds a healthier option to the diet.

cont.entity_a: Good quality for the price, but not suitable for frequent use. Beautiful shiny stainless steel finish and sturdy construction.
cont.entity_b: Good value for the price. The product has a long lifespan and won't need replacement. Beautiful cookware, good for poaching salmon. Light gauge steel but good value for the price. Rust spots appeared after a few uses, indicating poor quality.

cont.entity_a: Removable shelf makes it easy to remove fish without breaking.
Handles are not riveted, leading to potential safety hazards.

cont.entity_b: Beautiful cookware, good for poaching salmon.

cont.entity_a: Clean up is easy. Dishwasher use can cause handles to fall off.
cont.entity_b: Dishwasher use is not recommended but has held up so far. Stainless steel construction makes it easy to clean. Adequate gauge of steel and cleans without leaving salt marks.

cont.entity_a: The product is made in China.
The poacher is lightweight and cheaply made.
cont.entity_b: Lightweight stainless steel, easy to clean, but thin.
